alert.note: Alert for St. Louis (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 12 at 3:47PM CDT until further notice by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Minnesota, north central Minnesota and northeast Minnesota, including the following areas, in east central Minnesota, Aitkin, Crow Wing and Pine. In north central Minnesota, Cass and Itasca. In northeast Minnesota, Carlton and St. Louis. * WHEN...Until 1230 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. Multiple county, forest, or township roads may become flooded, especially those in low lying areas. Check with your county for additional information. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 341 PM CDT, Spring snowmelt will continue with above normal temperatures this week. A near record amount of water stored in the snowpack will be released. This will cause rapid snowmelt runoff leading to ponding of water and quick rises on streams and rivers. Minor flooding is expected in the advisory area. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and to the National Weather Service in Duluth when you can do so safely. Flooding can be reported to the National Weather Service at 1-800-685-8612.
